models module¶

class models.LSTM(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)¶

Bases: Module

A class used to represent a LSTM Model with flexible architectures.

Attributes:

  • num_epochs: The number of epoches runs for training.

  • lstm_layers: List of LSTM layers.

  • relu: Activation function.

  • fc: Linear transformation to the output.

Methods:

  • forward(x): Build to process the input data throught layers and return the outputs.

forward(x)¶

Define the forward method to pass input.

Parameters:

x (torch.Tensor) – The input tensor.

Returns:

Output tensor.

Return type:

torch.Tensor

models.train_model(model, ts, n_features, train_loader, val_loader, optimiser, criterion, scheduler, is_early_stop=False, threshold=20)¶

Train and validate the LSTM model.

Parameters:

  • model (torch.nn.Module) – The model to be trained and validated, such as LSTM.

  • ts (int) – The time sequence length, the number of time steps to be considered in model.

  • n_features (int) – The number of features used in training.

  • train_loader (torch.utils.data.DataLoader) – The training data loader used to train the model.

  • val_loader (torch.utils.data.DataLoader) – The validation data loader used to validate the model.

  • optimiser (torch.optim.Adam) – The optimiser to update the weights of model during the training, such as Adam.

  • criterion (torch.nn.modules) – The loss function used to calcualte the training and validation loss, such as MSE.

  • scheduler (torch.optim.lr_scheduler.StepLR.) – The scheduler used to adjust learning rate

  • is_early_stop (bool, optional) – Whether to enable early stopping or not, default is False.

  • threshold (int, optional) – Determine when to stop the training, e.g stop if no improvement in the next ‘threshold’ continuous epochs, default is 20 epochs.

Returns:

A tuple containing the training and validation losses for each epoch.

Return type:

tuple(list, list)
